title: Just got told I was trash because...
body:
All I do is spam spells and auto win... 

Yea please, tell me how having 325MS, and short range is "auto winning" against a ranged champ that can stun.... 

{{champion:82}}  vs {{champion:85}} 

If it was really that easy morde would be #1 playrate NA... Please stop saying x is op just because you don't know how to use your advantage.

replies.body:
Kennen that only has to press R, run into five people and win the fight for his team says Morde is auto-win? He legit has one of, if not the strongest ultimate in the game.

Never played Morde but at least i know he's challenging to play.

I wouldn't say he's challenging. But he's not exactly braindead. No super complex combos to learn, but he's not Yi/Voli/Kennen levels.

Probably a 3-4 on a 1-10 scale.

Yi is more mechanical 

only top 1% players know how to do the W combo

> [{quoted}](name=Poske,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=GK9umssR,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2018-03-02T19:35:58.233+0000)
>
> Yi is more mechanical 
> 
> only top 1% players know how to do the W combo

You mean, aa reset? 
It's not that hard.
its not easy either

The AA reset Ian pretty easy. 

Knowing how to use his Q properly is WAYY harder

> [{quoted}](name=DuskDaUmbreon,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=GK9umssR,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2018-03-02T17:58:07.427+0000)
>
> I wouldn't say he's challenging. But he's not exactly braindead. No super complex combos to learn, but he's not Yi/Voli/Kennen levels.
> 
> Probably a 3-4 on a 1-10 scale.

Anyone saying Yi is braindead is either Bronze or never played him.
Yi is a champion that has a low skillfloor and a high skillcap, meaning that basically anyone can pick him up with ease, but only a few will ever master him. Therefore, in a way, he is braindead.

> [{quoted}](name=WrÆth,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=GK9umssR,comment-id=0000000000030000,timestamp=2018-03-03T16:04:40.231+0000)
>
> Yi is a champion that has a low skillfloor and a high skillcap, meaning that basically anyone can pick him up with ease, but only a few will ever master him. Therefore, in a way, he is braindead.

This way of saying it I can agree with ^^

> [{quoted}](name=DuskDaUmbreon,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=GK9umssR,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2018-03-02T17:58:07.427+0000)
>
> I wouldn't say he's challenging. But he's not exactly braindead. No super complex combos to learn, but he's not Yi/Voli/Kennen levels.
> 
> Probably a 3-4 on a 1-10 scale.

Yi requires more skill to play well than Mordekaiser.

And let's be honest: Mordekaiser is easy to play. There's nothing wrong with that, and shit-talking someone for playing an easy champion is the pinnacle of butthurt, but the champion is easy.

Mordekaiser doesnt really have mechanics

I mean you can Auto creep into hidden E.. You can control his ulti just like with all the pets. But those arent really mechanics



He is a massive stat checker and In Order to stat check your enemy needs to go full retarded

i agree with the fact that he has no mechanics

but then you called him a stat checker when dude is massively delayed

nop

massively delayed stat checker?

stat checking doesnt imply burst

read the definition of stat checking by meddler

a stat checking champion is a champion that absolutly has no strategy to win over him except having more stats than him

Morde has one strategy that works really well: don't let him pull off all his spells that take age to have full effect, and the fact that he has 1700 base hp should help you to burst him without him having the time to shield himself
I like how you both talk alike, its so fucking cute and adorable

He actually has a few animation cancels that take awhile to learn. I see a lot of new Morde players never taking advantage of it.

Or Mordekaisers NEVER popping their W before they clear an entire wave, missing the heal. Orrrrr not popping W to heal a teammate in a close fight, and just having the DoT run for the entire duration, letting their teammate die for no reason.
Talk about this animation cancels plz

No champion takes no skill.
No champion takes "all" the skill.
Every champ requires knowledge and understanding of match ups, positioning, builds, skills etc...

Unless you can just Right click at range nuke someone right? 

I sure do love adc's.

Ahhhhh that's the exact comment i've been baiting for.
Nice hypocracy man, so im gonna quote you on your own post:

"Please dont say x is OP just because you dont know how to use your advantage." - GigglesO

Thanks fam
(If your comment was somehow sarcasm, disregard this comment)
Just giving you what you were looking for.
Thanks fam ✌

The only actual issue I have with ad champions is when they do something silly like. 

{{item:3147}} {{item:3087}} {{item:3094}}{{item:3078}} +dark harvest  and they sit in a bush. Its like the old shaco bush traps. You aren't really sure why you face checked an unwarded bush, but you know you just went from 100-0 for doing it. Its kinda tilting to die in .5ish seconds. 

Other than that bull shit I actually main morde as adc, so while frustrating, I don't find them unmanageable. All champs are frustrating given the right context.

> [{quoted}](name=GigglesO,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=GK9umssR,comment-id=000300000000000000000000,timestamp=2018-03-02T20:05:25.722+0000)
>
> The only actual issue I have with ad champions is when they do something silly like. 
> 
> {{item:3147}} {{item:3087}} {{item:3094}}{{item:3078}} +dark harvest  and they sit in a bush. Its like the old shaco bush traps. You aren't really sure why you face checked an unwarded bush, but you know you just went from 100-0 for doing it.

{{champion:86}}
When sitting in the bush is the strategy.

Literaly anyone building this will assassinate you.
Good thing your nexus isnt covered in bushes so camping a bush isnt a legit start to winning actual games.

i mean i was a garbage d1 hardstuck player

and got to challenger with morde this season
this should say something
Morde es #1 always shield never die huehueuhue

>garbage

>d1

Can you guys fuck off with this? It's like listening to people with 7 figure salaries say they aren't rich because there's people who make 10 figures.
Have you played on NA yet? Just wondering how big the skill difference actually is if there is any difference at all.

yea i played two times
one time when lucian was so broken (E removing slows) and nobody banned him so i spammed him and got to diamond 5 with 180 pings

this was when the server of NA was on west

now they moved it i have ~~120 pings, played few games on NA nearly one year and a half ago and got to plat2 with darius
https://i.gyazo.com/18194e4d3c6941669f4eb01dd6c6cba2.png

then i moved back my acc to EUW to get better pings

i wish i played on NA with good pings, in the future if i have money i actually wish to visit the USA just to play on NA server because they have better high elo players (i think)

there aren't much known EUW players, do you know any famous streamers from EUW? don't think so
NA has much more famous people, and all the good pro players from euw like bjergsen went to NA

The only thing free win about mordekaiser is that most people have negative practice with the matchup.

Mordekaiser is garbage, there's a reason he'll never be picked up in the LCS at this state.

First part is hilariously true, last part is true as well.

Second part? It's wrong. Morde isn't garbage at any tier *but* pro.
Morde is garbage at pro.* Using the affirmative will usually give you a simpler and more understandable sentence.

However, it doesn't imply his/her main argument: Mordekaiser isn't garbage.

By saying "Morde is garbage at pro", you do not deny that "Morde is garbage at any tier".

Simplicity sure is nice, but a complete argument with very few questionable implications is much better than a simple argument that may not actually represent your perspective.

One last thing: his/her sentence is very easy to understand and follow. 

I don't know why people hate negative sentences when it is clearly stated that they are in opposition to something mentined before "Second part? It's wrong." The only possible reasons would be lack of interest (which means that people don't want to discuss about it) or concentration (a weak reason in my opinion).
The only no-skill Champ is "literally-does-nothing-but-right-click-because-he-doesn't-even-have-spells McGee" {{champion:77}}
Because the right order really matters when you are clicking a skill every second?
Does for the passive proc.
I'm with ya mate, people cry OP way too easily nowadays.
agreed. but i think the most dont mean OP but toxic. there is a fine line between those two. yasuo is imo a toxic champ. shaco too etc. but OP... OP is imo the new bruiser rune for example.

It is kinda interesting that they want to ignore resists so badly.

I think tanks are gonna take a beating, but with all this pen, I'm not sure it was necessary to do something that gives that much true damage.
Must've been a first time Kennen.
Just give them a hearty Hue Hue Hue next time.

The difficult part of {{champion:82}} is to get into range
Get in without dying

People who say that are usually bad themselves but the truth hasn't sinked in yet.
So you know, it's everyone who's an ass for playing "easy" or "broken" champs - and this is always being said by the guy who's playing something easy or meta (which is proven to work already).
Aha!  I found you!
Been a few days since I posted. Just not playing as much recently, I still miss lower damage meta.

> [{quoted}](name=GigglesO,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=GK9umssR,comment-id=00070000,timestamp=2018-03-02T21:54:08.689+0000)
>
> Been a few days since I posted. Just not playing as much recently, I still miss lower damage meta.

Yeah and I still miss competitive toplanes, but good news everybody! They are fixing some of the toplane problems and giving us a keystone (more damage)!
